definition[0]: to prevent something from touching or harming something
example[0]: She held an old piece of cloth over them both to keep the rain off.
example[1]: How are we going to keep the flies off this food?
definition[1]: used to tell someone not to touch someone or something
definition[2]: to not eat, drink, or take something that is bad for you, or to stop someone else from eating, drinking, or taking it
example[4]: a programme aimed at keeping teenagers off drugs
definition[3]: to avoid talking about a particular subject, especially so that you do not upset someone
definition[4]: if you keep weight off, you do not get heavier again after you have lost weight
definition[5]: if rain keeps off, it does not fall
